title: pRolocGUI - Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: pRolocGUI active development; current functionality evolving new features added. software free open-source. invited open issues Github pRolocGUI repository case questions, suggestions found bugs typos. reach broader audience general questions proteomics analyses using R consider writing Bioconductor Support Forum.

title: pRolocGUI - Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: vignette describes implemented functionality pRolocGUI package. package based MSnSet class definitions MSnbase functions defined pRoloc package. pRolocGUI intended , limited , interactive visualisation analysis quantitative spatial proteomics data. achieve reactivity interactivity, pRolocGUI relies shiny framework. recommend familiarity MSnSet class (see ?MSnSet details) pRoloc vignette (see vignette("pRoloc-tutorial")) using pRolocGUI. 3 applications distributed pRolocGUI wrapped launched pRolocVis function. 3 applications called according argument app pRolocVis function may one “explore”, “compare” “aggregate”. explore application launches interactive spatial map (dimensionality reduction) data, alternate profiles tab visualisation protein profiles. searchable data table identification proteins interest functionality download figures export proteins interest. compare application features functionality explore app allows comparison two MSnSet instances, e.g. might help analyses changes protein localisation different conditions. aggregate application allows users load peptide PSM level data look relationship peptides proteins (following aggregation).

title: pRolocGUI - Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: R started, first step enable functionality package load , shown code chunk . also load pRolocdata data package, contains quantitative proteomics datasets. begin loading dataset hyperLOPIT2015 pRolocdata data package. data produced using hyperLOPIT technology mouse E14TG2a embryonic stem cells (Christoforou et al 2016). background spatial proteomics data anlayses please see Gatto et al 2010, Gatto et al 2014 also pRoloc tutorial vignette. load one applications using pRolocVis function view data required specify minimum one key argument, object, data display must class MSnSet (MSnSetList length 2 compare application). Please see vignette("pRoloc-tutorial") vignette("MSnbase-io") importing loading data. argument app tells pRolocVis function type application load. One can choose : "explore" (default), "compare" "aggregate". optional argument fcol used specify feature meta-data label(s) (fData column name(s)) plotted, default markers (.e. labelled data). compare app can character length 2, first element label dataset 1 second element dataset 2 (one element provide label used datasets, detail provided examples .) example, load default pRolocVis application: Launching pRolocVis applications open new tab separate pop-window, application can opened default Internet browser desired, clicking ‘open browser’ button top panel window. stop applications running press Esc Ctrl-C console (use “STOP” button using RStudio) close browser tab, pRolocVis running.
code: library("pRolocGUI") library("pRolocdata") data(hyperLOPIT2015) pRolocVis(object = hyperLOPIT2015, fcol = "markers")

title: pRolocGUI - Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: 3 different applications, one designed address different specific user requirement. explore app intended exploratory data analysis, features clickable interface zoomable spatial map. default spatial map form PCA plot, many dimensionality reduction techniques supported including t-SNE MDS among others. like search particular protein set proteins application use. app also features protein profiles tab, designed examining patterns user-specified sets proteins. example, one several overlapping sub-cellular clusters data, highlighted PCA plot otherwise, one can check separation data dimensions examining protein profile patterns. Proteins co-localise known exhibit similar distributions (De Duve’s principale). comparison application may interest user wishes examine two replicate experiments, two experiments different conditions etc. Two spatial maps loaded side--side one can search identify common proteins two data sets. per default application also protein profiles tab allow one look patterns protein profiles interest dataset. aggregate app examining effect peptide PSM aggregation may protein level data.

title: pRolocGUI - Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: explore (default) app characterised interactive searchable spatial map, default Principal Components Analysis (PCA) plot. PCA ordinance method can used transform high-dimensional dataset smaller lower-dimenensional set uncorrelated variables (principal components), first principal component largest possible variance account much variability data possible. succeeding component turn highest variance possible constraint orthogonal preceding components. Thus, PCA particularly useful visualisation multidimensional data 2-dimensions, wherein proteins can plotted figure. dimensionality reduction methods supported t-SNE, among others (please see ?plot2D argument method) application subdivided different tabs: (1) Spatial Map, (2) Profiles, (3) Profiles (class), (4) Table Selection, (5) Sample info (6) Colour picker. searchable data table containing experimental feature meta-data permanantly dispalyed bottom screen ease. can browse tabs simply clicking top screen. run explore application using pRolocVis: Viewing Spatial Map tab characterised main panel shows PCA plot selected MSnSet. default PCA plot used display data first two principal components plotted. left sidebar panel controls class labels (sub-cellular compartments) highlight PCA plot. Labels can selected clicking coloured data class names, removed/highlighted clicking “Select/clear ” button. right sidebar contains map controls. features ‘transparancy’ slider control opacity highlighted data points, buttons detail . Searching spatial map searchable data table containing fetaure meta data (fData). LOPIT experiments, one used example, may contain protein accession numbers, protein entry names, protein description, number quantified peptides per protein, columns containing sub-cellular localisation information. One can search proteins interest using white search box, table. Searching done partial pattern matching table elements. matches partial text matches found highlighted data table. search supports batch searching users can paste favourite sets proteins, protein accessions/keywords must separated spaces. select/unselect protein interest one can simply click/unclick corresponding entry table double click directly protein interest interactive PCA plot. protein(s) table clicked selected row table turn grey protein(s) highlighted PCA plot dark grey circle(s), ‘Show labels’ box checked (default) right sidebar panel protein names selected protein(s) also shown plot. selected proteins plot table can cleared time clicking ‘Clear selection’ button right sidebar panel. Saving selected proteins proteins highlighted table /plot can exported using “Save selection” button right sidebar. download ids (defined featureNames MSnSet object) current protein selection .csv file. Zooming user wishes examine protein(s) detail, one can zoom specific points hovering mouse plot, clicking drawing (square) brush clicking ‘Zoom/reset button’ right sidebar zoom brushed area. process can repeated desired level zoom reached. plot can resetted original size clicking ‘Zoom/reset button’ .  Downloading figures visualisations app (map two profile plots) can downloaded high resolution PDFs clicking “Download Plot” button right sidebar panel. Hiding sidebar panels left right sidebar panels can shown/hidden time clicking icons main dashboard. profiles tabs two profiles tabs pRolocGUI display protein profile quantitation data stored exprs data slot MSnSet. hyperLOPIT2015 dataset relative abundances protein across 20 fractions (2 x 10-plex replicates). first “Profiles” tab shows two ribbons plots, one dataset. per Spatial Map tab, plot updated according input classes selected sidebar panel left. ribbon plotted sub-cellular class 5th 95th percentile value per channel. mean class profile also highlighted bold line. Unknown/unlabelled profiles shown dark gray lines. profiles tab useful look discrimination different sub-cellular niches easy direct manor proteins belonging sub-cellular niche/data cluster (specified fcol app launched) loaded together. protein distribution patterns can examined group group basis. Proteins interest can searched data table clicked, distribution(s) selected protein(s) shown dotted black lines. second profiles tab called “Profiles (class)” shows protein profiles faceted class labels. static plot can useful comparing trend classes, especially two classes similar trends. Table Selection Table Selection tab provides interface data table column selection. Multiple columns can selected clicking/unclicking checkboxes correspond columns data table. Sample Information tab “Sample Info” stores sample information stored pData slot MSnSet. Colour Picker tab provides interface select set colours class labels.

title: pRolocGUI - Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: comparison application may interest user wishes examine two replicate experiments, two experiments different conditions etc. Two Spatial Map plots loaded side--side (default method PCA) one can search identify common proteins two data sets. MSnSetList length 2 must supplied input, containing two datasets one wishes compare. example load two replicate datasets mouse embryonic stem cells produced using hyperLOPIT technology. load datasets hyperLOPIT2015ms3r1 hyperLOPIT2015ms3r2 side side use column name called markers colour labelling plots. pass fcol length 2 app can specify different feature data columns label dataset. example, proceeding example load data LOPIT-DC experiment, lopitdcU2OS2018, hyperLOPIT experiment, hyperLOPITU2OS2018. wish display feature data contained column called markers hyperLOPITU2OS2018, different set features lopitdcU2OS2018, called final.assignment specify using fcol follows. compare app functionality explore application protein profile visualisation,interactive searchable datatable allows batch import export, colour selection options download visualisations. Visualisations tables appear tab loaded side--side, one per dataset.
code: data(hyperLOPIT2015ms3r1) data(hyperLOPIT2015ms3r2) mydata <- MSnSetList(list(hyperLOPIT2015ms3r1, hyperLOPIT2015ms3r2)) pRolocVis(mydata, app = "compare", fcol = "markers") data("hyperLOPITU2OS2018") data("lopitdcU2OS2018") xx <- MSnSetList(list(hyperLOPITU2OS2018, lopitdcU2OS2018)) if (interactive()) {   pRolocVis(xx, app = "compare", fcol = c("markers", "final.assignment")) }

title: pRolocGUI - Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: aggregate app allows users look peptide (/PSM) /protein level data together explore effects PSM/protein aggregation protein identify protein groups interesting expression patterns. run aggregate app first load PSM level dataset pRolocdata. dataset hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm contains PSM level intensity data, row corresponds one PSM column TMT-plex. Please see ?hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm information. can launch pRolocVis function look PSM data without aggregating peptide can first aggregate PSM peptide launch app look relationships peptide level data protein groups. latter case can use combineFeatures function MSnbase. main body app contains (1) aggvar distance plot (2) PCA plot PSMs/peptides. aggvar distance plot shows (log10) number features (example peptides) per protein group aggregation summarising distance per protein group. app uses function aggvar MSnbase package. described ?aggvar documentation, app, can take max mean function, can selected left sidebar panel. default, loading max calculated. Using max function, one can help identify protein groups single extreme outliers, , example, mis-identified peptide erroneously assigned protein group. mean can also used function identify systematic inconsistencies , example, subsets peptide (PSM) feautres correspond proteins different expression patterns. aggvar plot PCA plot interactive, similarly pRolocVis apps can click individual proteins peptides either aggvar PCA plot, search highlight peptides proteins interest. protein group clicked left plot, peptides associated protein group automatically shown right PCA plot. previously mentioned aggvar can use either max mean function. left sidebar drop menu users try method.
code: ## load PSM data data("hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm")  ## Visualise the PSMs per to protein group pRolocVis(hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm, app = "aggregate", fcol = "markers",           groupBy = "Protein.Group.Accessions") ## Combine PSM data to peptides hl <- combineFeatures(hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm,                       groupBy = fData(hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm)$Sequence,                       method = median)  ## Visualise peptides according to protein group pRolocVis(hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm, app = "aggregate", fcol = "markers",           groupBy = "Protein.Group.Accessions")

title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: pRolocGUI package interactive interface explore visualise experimental mass spectrometry-based spatial proteomics data. relies shiny framework interactive visualisation, MSnbase package handle data metadata pRoloc software spatial proteomics specific data matters. Example spatial data available pRolocdata experiment package. pRoloc suite set software distributed part R/Bioconductor project developed Lisa Breckels Cambridge Centre Proteomics University Cambridge Laurent Gatto, director Computational Biology Bioinformatics (CBIO) group UCLouvain, Belgium. document describes installation software, followed basic quick start guide using pRolocGUI search visualise spatial proteomics data. Please refer respective documentation vignettes full details software. use open-source software research, please cite: Gatto L, Breckels LM, Wieczorek S, Burger T, Lilley KS. Mass-spectrometry-based spatial proteomics data analysis using pRoloc pRolocdata. Bioinformatics. 2014 May 1;30(9):1322-4. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btu013. Epub 2014 Jan 11. PMID:24413670; PMCID:PMC3998135. Breckels LM, Gatto L, Christoforou , Groen AJ, Lilley KS, Trotter MW. effect organelle discovery upon sub-cellular protein localisation. J Proteomics. 2013 Mar 21. doi:pii: S1874-3919(13)00094-8. 10.1016/j.jprot.2013.02.019. PMID:23523639. Gatto L., Breckels L.M., Burger T, Nightingale D.J.H., Groen .J., Campbell C., Mulvey C.M., Christoforou ., Ferro M., Lilley K.S. ‘foundation reliable spatial proteomics data analysis’ Mol Cell Proteomics. 2014 May 20.

Install Bioconductor packages pRoloc, pRolocdata pRolocGUI: pRolocGUI requires R >= 3.1.1 Bioconductor version >= 3.0. R console, type

title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
text: using package’s functionality, needs loaded: first load data Christoforou et al 2016 distributed pRolocdata package: 3 different visualisation applications currently available: explore, compare aggregate. apps launched using pRolocVis function passing object, MSnSet containing data one wishes interrogate. One may also specify app wish use using app argument, see ?pRolocVis details. default app loaded app specified explore application: graphical interface described details package vignette included package (get typing vignette("pRolocGUI") R), available clicking ? interface loaded can consulted online.

what: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data — pRolocVis
title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data — pRolocVis
text: functions allow one explore spatial proteomics data interactively.

title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data — pRolocVis
code: pRolocVis(object, app = "explore", fcol = "markers", ...)  pRolocVis_aggregate(   object,   fcol = "markers",   groupBy,   fig.height = "700px",   nchar = 25,   ... )  pRolocVis_compare(   object,   fcol = "markers",   classProfiles = FALSE,   fig.height = "400px",   nchar = 25,   ... )  pRolocVis_explore(   object,   fcol = "markers",   classProfiles = FALSE,   fig.height = "700px",   nchar = 25,   ... )

title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data — pRolocVis
text: object instance class MSnSet, MSnSetList length 2 using "compare" application. app type application requested: "explore" (default), "compare" "aggregate". See description . fcol feature meta-data label (fData column name) used colouring. Default "markers". set NULL, annotation expected. "compare" app, character vector length 2 allowed set different labels dataset. one label specified, single label used identify annotation column datasets. Please see example herein. ... Additional parameters passed plot2D "explore" (dimensionality reduction technique, methods), "compare" apps. "aggregate" app additional parameters passed combineFeatures. groupBy feature meta-data label (fData column name) used summarising features combined. fig.height Height figure. nchar Maximum number characters subcellular class names, names truncated. Default 25. classProfiles logical indicating tab displaying individual class profile plots displayed. Default FALSE.

title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data — pRolocVis
text: function pRolocVis wrapper pRolocVis_pca, pRolocVis_compare. pRolocVis_aggregate. Shiny apps allow explore analyse interactively spatial proteomics data. explore Shiny app allows exploration quantitative data (1) visually projection dataset, (2) protein profiles, (3) searchable feature data table, allowing visualisation sets proteins interest. compare Shiny app meant comparing protein localisation two conditions, two different experiments, replicates etc. aggregation Shiny app displays scatter plot maximum mean distances within feature (e.g. protein group) according components (e.g. peptides) defined groupBy argument. PCA plot components also displayed. can used visualising peptides, PSMs features defined feature data MSnSet distributions.

title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data — pRolocVis
text: Lisa Breckels, Thomas Naake Laurent Gatto

title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data — pRolocVis
code: library("pRoloc") library("pRolocdata") #>  #> This is pRolocdata version 1.43.1. #> Use 'pRolocdata()' to list available data sets.  ## Load the Explore app data(hyperLOPIT2015) if (interactive()) {   pRolocVis(hyperLOPIT2015)   pRolocVis(hyperLOPIT2015, method = "t-SNE")   ## store the t-SNE coords and pass a matrix to pRolocVis   xx <- plot2D(hyperLOPIT2015, method = "t-SNE")   pRolocVis(xx, method = "none", methargs = list(hyperLOPIT2015)) }  ## Load the Compare app data("hyperLOPITU2OS2018") data("lopitdcU2OS2018") xx <- MSnSetList(list(hyperLOPITU2OS2018, lopitdcU2OS2018)) if (interactive()) {   pRolocVis(xx, app = "compare", fcol = c("markers", "final.assignment")) }  ## Visualise the location and distribution of peptides per protein group data("hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm") if (interactive()) {   ## Combine PSM data to peptides   hl <- combineFeatures(hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm,                         groupBy = fData(hyperLOPIT2015ms2psm)$Sequence,                         method = median)   ## Visualise peptides according to protein group   pRolocVis(hl, app = "aggregate", fcol = "markers",             groupBy = "Protein.Group.Accessions") }
